report_title: e-Discovery Consulting Services in the US
executive_summary: Operators in the e-discovery consulting services industry meet with legal professionals, government officials and other businesses to assist in data management and data collection on their systems. In addition, e-discovery services enable companies to process and compile data, which can be used in litigation or government investigations. Over the past five years, consumers and businesses' rapidly increasing use of digital systems has spurred demand for services, albeit interrupted by a decline in demand because of a decline in corporate profit in 2020 amid the pandemic. Over the past five years, revenue has grown at a CAGR of 3.2% to $6.1 billion, including an expected 3.2% increase in 2023. Profit is expected to slump to 6.4% of revenue in 2023 from 6.7% in 2018.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Demand for Industry Services Hikes as Mobile Internet Connections and Time Spent Online Expand
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The rising demand for e-discovery has primarily been driven by changes in how people and businesses communicate. An increasing proportion of communication occurs electronically through e-mail, text messages or other digital methods. Operators must find new ways to find data because of an increasingly diverse number of data sources. This trend has become more evident as cloud computing has become more popular.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Increased Investments in Computers and Software Have Benefitted the Industry
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The number of broadband internet connections has expanded over the past five years. As the capabilities of internet infrastructure in the United States have improved dramatically over the past five years, the myriad uses of the internet for previously analog services have increased steadily and contributed to investment in computers and software. Private investment in computers and software has grown rapidly over the past five years.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Data Dependence Will Be a Critical Driver of Demand and Revenue Growth for the Industry
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The growing significance of technology in consumer and business transactions will continue to be the primary driver of industry performance. The percentage of services conducted online is expected to continue climbing over the next five years, indicating a strong reliance on internet systems. The volume of data in online and offline digital systems will continue expanding, increasing demand for services.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Law Firms Will Increasingly Seek to Establish E-Discovery Programs
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Law firms have begun to establish in-house e-discovery programs. Law firms establishing in-house e-discovery services will positively and negatively impact the industry. As law firms implement e-discovery programs, this could potentially increase demand for e-discovery software and systems integration; however, law firms establishing e-discovery departments will reduce demand for e-discovery consulting services in the longer term and slow revenue growth.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Government Investment Will Expand as Government Agencies Increase Demand for Services
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Government agencies will increase demand for technology-driven personnel to handle upcoming issues of obsolete proprietary data and new challenges in processing multiple forms of data. According to research from Deloitte in 2018 (latest data available), over two-thirds of government respondents felt that they were only somewhat or not at all confident that, if challenged, their agency could demonstrate that their ESI was accurate, complete and trustworthy.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Consolidation Will Enable Operators to Provide One-Stop-Shop Services
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Operators will increasingly acquire or be acquired by software companies that offer e-discovery software. This consolidation will contribute to a greater number of operators that provide one-stop-shop services. Companies specializing in e-discovery consulting services will increasingly compete with software giants. New entrants will enter the industry as consulting barriers to entry are low and the high rate of technological change creates an entry platform for companies with new technology and the ability to lead the market.

industry_definition: This industry provides e-discovery services, usually for software and systems integration, that search, locate and secure data to use as evidence in court. Industry operators provide e-discovery consulting services, including collecting, processing and reviewing data, to end users like law firms, corporations, hospitals and government agencies. This industry excludes e-discovery software publishing, although some consulting firms may also develop their own software.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Law firms are the primary market for e-discovery consultants, with revenue generated through business litigation. Companies will hire a law firm or legal consultant once notification of pending legal action has been served.

Government agencies are the smallest market for the industry but account for roughly one-quarter of revenue. The increasing use of record management in the public sector generates the need for e-discovery and digital investigations.
Other markets include nonprofit organizations, individuals and other companies seeking assistance with e-discovery services.

products_and_services.product_description: Operators obtain over one-half of revenue from processing, reviewing and analyzing information. Processing, review and analysis occur after the information is identified, preserved and collected.

Information management services are the second-largest product segment in the industry. In this category, operators work with companies to ensure that electronic information is well organized to reduce the expense and risk of e-discovery.

Identification is the first step in the e-discovery process and generates the fourth-largest revenue share. The potential sources of ESI and what information could be possibly relevant are determined in this step.
Preservation and collection are the third and fourth steps in the collection process. In total, these steps generate the third-largest share of revenue.
During the production phase of the e-discovery process, the data is delivered to the parties that need it.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Law firms represent the largest market
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Law firms represent the largest market for operators because corporate attorneys demand e-discovery services for use in business litigation.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region consists of the majority of establishments.
The West region comprises the second-largest concentration of establishments.
The Mid-Atlantic region is estimated to account for the third-largest concentration of establishments.

regulations_points.regulation_title: The level of regulation and policy-making is increasing
regulations_points.regulation_description: IBISWorld estimates the level of regulation and policy-making regarding e-discovery to be low.

barriers_points.barrier_description: On the legal end, the laws governing e-discovery may differ from state to state, so new entrants would likely be relegated to local or niche consulting markets.

basis_points.basis_description: The breadth of service offerings is a critical form of competition for operators.
Operators encounter external competition from law firms.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Customers seek operators with wide range of services
concentration_points.concentration_description: Customers typically seek out companies with a wide array of services, including consulting and software services.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchase costs associated with computer hardware and software
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Most industry purchases are associated with computer hardware and software.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Fluctuations in the economy impact revenue
volatility_points.volatility_description: While industry growth has been strong, economic fluctuations still influence revenue.
